dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: I'd love to hear about how you ended up defecting to the West.

dialogue_content.original_text: It was in the late 70s, during a tour with the ballet company.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: It sounds like a bold decision. What was going through your mind at the time?

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: That must have been hard, leaving everything behind. How did you cope with being in a new place?

dialogue_content.original_text: I missed my family, my friends.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: But the ballet community here was welcoming.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: So when did things change for you after you settled in the West?

dialogue_content.original_text: Things really changed when I injured my knee.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: That must have been devastating, especially for a dancer. How did it happen?

dialogue_content.original_text: During a rehearsal, I landed awkwardly after a jump.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: What were some of the core challenges you faced during your recovery?

dialogue_content.original_text: The doctors said I wouldn't dance again professionally.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: That must have been incredibly tough to hear. How did you manage to move forward after that?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: I had to find a new purpose. Teaching became my focus.

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: Teaching must have been a big adjustment. What was it like transitioning from performing to teaching?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: Transitioning wasn't easy. I had to learn patience. Teaching is different; you guide others rather than express yourself.

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: I'd love to hear how teaching kids has been for you now.

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: It sounds like teaching has brought you a lot of fulfillment. How do you feel looking back at your journey from dancer to teacher?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: Looking back, I see it as a full circle. I miss performing, but teaching gives me a sense of purpose I didn't expect.

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: So, how do you feel about the impact you've had on your students over the years?

dialogue_content.original_text: That's all a teacher can ask for.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: That's a wonderful sentiment. What's one of your proudest moments as a teacher?

dialogue_content.original_text: There's a student who went on to join a professional company.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: Before we finish, what's one final lesson you'd share with those aspiring to follow in your footsteps?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: Never stop learning. Life will change, and you must adapt. Embrace every stage.
